alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Goochland; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Goochland, northwestern Henrico, southwestern Caroline, central Hanover and northwestern King William Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wyndham, or near Tuckahoe, moving northeast at 30 mph. This storm has a history of exhibiting rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Randolph Macon College, Tuckahoe, Hanover, Beulahville, Dawn, Glen Allen, Kings Dominion, Laurel, Wyndham, Mangohick, Gum Tree, Elmont, Etna Mills, Penola, Epworth, Gilman, Ashcake, Globe and Duane Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Goochland; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William
